meanings.definition: A person who has the right to vote in an election.
meanings.sent1: The electors lined up to cast their votes on election day.
meanings.sent2: The electors in the town hall voted for their favorite candidate.
meanings.sent3: The electors were excited to choose their new leader.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility of the electors is crucial in a democracy.
meanings.sent5: The electors play a vital role in shaping the future through their votes.

meanings.definition: A member of the electoral college.
meanings.sent1: Each elector in the college represents a different state.
meanings.sent2: The electors gathered to officially elect the president.
meanings.sent3: The electoral college electors had a meeting to discuss the upcoming election.
meanings.sent4: Being an elector in the college is a prestigious position.
meanings.sent5: The electors in the electoral college have an important duty to fulfill.

meanings.definition: A person who elects or chooses someone for a particular office or position.
meanings.sent1: The electors unanimously selected the new CEO for the company.
meanings.sent2: As electors, they have the power to decide the next mayor.
meanings.sent3: The electors had a tough time picking the best candidate for the job.
meanings.sent4: Being an elector means having the responsibility to make wise choices.
meanings.sent5: The electors carefully consider the qualifications of each candidate before choosing.
